cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Bahamas, forecast to skirt the Florida east coast Saturday–Sunday, then turn north-northwest and ride up the southeast U.S. coastline toward the Carolinas early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the east coast of Florida (Boca Raton–Vero Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (Hurricane/Tropical-storm watches)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton FL to the Volusia/Brevard County Line FL and much of the Bahamas (Hurricane warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through the Carolinas and up toward the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible with a low (6%) chance of 50-kt winds and a minimal (1%) chance of hurricane-force winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible along the southeast NC coast, including the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent sounds, if the storm tracks just offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated totals up to 6 inches could cause flash flooding and minor river flooding in coastal southeast North Carolina.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible coastal erosion will affect port approaches and channel operations.
